comments.body: PESU is 100% worth it through KCET. Thru PESSAT it's ok only if the fees are not a financial issue.
Can you dm me brother?
It depends on your options in hand.
Yup

I did mechanical engineering at PESU. My friends who did CS all entered through PESSAT. They all actually liked the course work and the only time they complained was when we had 5 internals instead of the two we have now.  It is pretty competitive as there were around 800 students in CS (in my batch) so it might get hard to cope at times.

First finish writing PESSAT And first Get ur PESSAT rank then we will see

I am graduating this year. I absolutely loved the course and most of teachers were amazing! Unfortunately tho, most of them left college or retired. My classmates were nice as well, not the rowdy gang. Our research culture has deteriorated a lot and the current HOD isn't very approachable or supportive. When it comes to placements, if your basics are decent, u can get placed easily. Bosch, LAM, Schneider, Mercedes Research are a few big names that come for mechanical. If u r girl, then it gets a lot easier with placements. I would personally not recommend PES for mech right now.

i'm in my final semester in Mech,TBH it's not really great at PES, When i say it's not grea8 i'm speaking for my whole batch, if you're looking forward for taking up Mech i'd suggest you look at RVCE OR BMSCE ( not BMSIT ).  I've joined through KCET. honestly the placements are really dogshit for Mech. Core Mech companies do come but end up recruiting CSE for IT roles or they taken in women in the name of diversity. I personally hope your give your decision of joining Mech in PES a second thought.
